reviews.review_msg: Most of the class will lose 5% participation marks if he does not know your name by the end of the course. Also, do not take this class if you hate group projects. The prof seems to think that all students participate equally when that is often not the case.
very nice professor...knows the diffuculty students go through very concerning...highly recommended

I loved this class, I also took HSCI 312 which made me take 403.   I found the term project to be very interesting. He is very understanding of late assignments and even re-writes, he wants to see students succeed! I really enjoyed this class and always recommend it.

Seems to genuinely care about students. His classes are not for everyone because he gives a lot of freedom in assignments which can be scary. But I enjoyed the class tremendously and learned some really useful stuff. A nice change from the rest of my classes!
I attended every class before the MT 1 and MT2 is essay from a novel you pick and group project as final..His mts and project are easy~

Including the bonus marks, there was never a time where I had less than A- in an assignment, homeowork, or exams. I was expecting to get an A or maybe an A+ in that course. but I got B+. There was no warning of scaling whatsoever. In the end it comes down to a fraction of a percentage that determines diff btwn A+ and B+. too big of a gap for me..
lectures are pointless. he really likes students to participate in class discussion (regardless of class size-can sometime be awkward)

Hes a nice guy but his class was very boring I felt like we talked about the same thing every lecture The entire class was based on what students thought about public health every class it was World War III between those who liked bike lanes and those who didn't I would rather listen to Dr Fedeles teach because it was actually an interesting course
